alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 3:19AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Benton. In northeast Oklahoma, Delaware. * WHEN...Until 630 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 319 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Siloam Springs... Jay... Grove... Gravette... Decatur... West Siloam Springs... Colcord... Kansas... Bernice... Oaks... Maysville... Honey Creek State Park... Twin Oaks... Leach... Bernice State Park... Lake Eucha State Park... Zena... Cherokee City... Natural Falls State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
